intro: Strobilanthes khoshooana, commonly known as the Kashmiri flame of the forest, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red floral display. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
